On Fri, 2010-07-30 at 03:09 -0600, Eric J. Bowman wrote:
>   
> "Suresh" wrote:
> >
> > One of the examples cited in the presentation is rotating an image
> in
> > flicker and the author claims using RPC style is natural and works
> > better than just using REST. Any thoughts??
> > 
> 
> First thought? Google ought to know better. If the desire is to GET
> an image from the server, rotated + or - x degrees, then the proper
> method is GET, not an RPC POST.
> 
> GET /image.jpg?rot=90

I'd agree with PUT over POST because you get a caching option (which is
usually what you want for image operations). Whether to use GET seems
like an it depends thing - if a resource was created as a side effect of
that GET, then GET was not the right thing.

It's Friday so I'd like to avoid a discussion on whether the resources
"/image.jpg?rot=90" exist to be discovered by people (therefore GET) or
whether they are man made inventions (therefore POST/PUT) 

;)

Bill
